noun.description: Each of the limbs on which a person or animal walks and stands.
examples: he was off as fast as his legs would carry him

noun.description: Each of the supports of a chair, table, or other piece of furniture.
A section or stage of a journey or process.
examples: the return leg of his journey

noun.description: A branch of a forked object.
The half of the field (as divided lengthways through the pitch) away from which the batsman's feet are pointed when standing to receive the ball.
An obeisance made by drawing back one leg and bending it while keeping the front leg straight.

verb.description: Propel (a boat) through a tunnel on a canal by pushing with one's legs against the tunnel roof or sides.

phrases: She began to feel her legs again, so she brought herself up to a stand with little effort.
She finally finds her legs and she runs to the door that leads to her backyard, expecting to find comfort in her cocker spaniel, Pounce.
Nikki faltered and found her legs again as she sat down.
My senses finally rushing back to me, I found my legs and charged out of the elevator with a vivacity that I didn't even know I possessed.
Fighting for air, Allie found her legs and began kicking upward in the frigid water.
origin: Middle English (superseding shank): from Old Norse leggr (compare with Danish læg calf (of the leg)), of Germanic origin.
